title: Lesson 16
paragraph: Entertainment and leisure bring joy and creative expression. From music and theatre to museums and hobbies, people enjoy performances, exhibitions and quiet reading. Spending free time on arts and hobbies helps relax and inspires new ideas.

words.meaning: a person who performs in plays, films or TV
words.example: The actor received praise for his role.

words.meaning: a female actor
words.example: The actress won an award for the film.

words.meaning: a collection of recorded music tracks
words.example: The band released their new album last month.

words.meaning: creative work such as painting, sculpture, or design
words.example: She studies modern art at university.

words.meaning: a person who creates art
words.example: The artist displayed paintings in the gallery.

words.meaning: a group of musicians who play together
words.example: The band performed at the festival.

words.meaning: a simple drawing or animated film often for humour
words.example: Children watched a cartoon on TV.

words.meaning: a place where films are shown; the film industry
words.example: They went to the cinema to see a new film.

words.meaning: a place or group for social or recreational activity
words.example: She joined a book club at the library.

words.meaning: a public musical performance
words.example: We bought tickets for the concert.

words.meaning: to move rhythmically to music
words.example: They dance at parties every weekend.

words.meaning: a person who dances professionally or for pleasure
words.example: The dancer practised for hours.

words.meaning: a play or serious performance for theatre or TV
words.example: The drama received excellent reviews.

words.meaning: a percussion instrument that makes sound when hit
words.example: The drummer played the drum loudly.

words.meaning: a public display of art or items of interest
words.example: The museum opened a new exhibition.

words.meaning: a person who admires or supports someone or something
words.example: Fans waited to see the band leave the studio.

words.meaning: an event celebrated with performances and activities
words.example: The city holds a film festival every year.

words.meaning: a motion picture or movie
words.example: They watched a classic film at home.

words.meaning: a place where art is displayed
words.example: Visit the gallery to see contemporary works.

words.meaning: a stringed musical instrument played by strumming
words.example: He practised the guitar every day.

words.meaning: an activity done for pleasure in free time
words.example: Gardening is her favourite hobby.

words.meaning: a musical device used to produce sound
words.example: The orchestra used many instruments.

words.meaning: a style of music with improvisation and swing
words.example: They listened to a jazz band at the club.

words.meaning: something said or done to cause laughter
words.example: He told a joke that made everyone laugh.

words.meaning: free time when one is not working
words.example: She enjoys reading in her leisure time.

words.meaning: written works such as novels, poetry and essays
words.example: He studies English literature at college.

words.meaning: a building where objects of historical or artistic value are kept
words.example: We visited the science museum on Sunday.

words.meaning: a long fictional book
words.example: She finished reading a mystery novel.

words.meaning: a large group of musicians playing together
words.example: The orchestra performed beautifully.

words.meaning: an artwork made with paint
words.example: The painting hung in the gallery.

words.meaning: an act of presenting artistic work to an audience
words.japaneseMeaning: 演技、演奏、パフォーマンス
words.example: The performance lasted two hours.

words.meaning: a large keyboard musical instrument
words.example: She practised piano for the recital.

words.meaning: a dramatic work performed on stage
words.example: The school staged a play in June.

words.meaning: a short piece of writing expressing feelings with rhythm and imagery
words.example: He wrote a poem about the sea.

words.meaning: a person who writes poems
words.example: The poet read his new work aloud.

words.meaning: literary art using rhythm and language
words.example: Poetry can express deep feelings.

words.meaning: a planned event or broadcast
words.example: The TV programme begins at eight.

words.meaning: a place that serves drinks and often food
words.example: They met friends at the local pub.

words.meaning: a short test or fun competitive question game
words.example: The quiz night at the club is popular.

words.meaning: a device or broadcast using radio waves to send sound
words.example: Listen to the news on the radio.

words.meaning: a person who reads or a device for reading
words.example: An avid reader finished the book in two days.

words.meaning: the activity of interpreting written text
words.example: Reading improves vocabulary.

words.meaning: to capture sound for later playback
words.example: They will record the new single this week.

words.meaning: a genre of popular music often featuring guitars and drums
words.example: They love rock music from the 1970s.

words.meaning: a performance or broadcast for entertainment
words.example: The magic show was amazing.

words.meaning: a person who sings
words.example: The singer released a hit single.

words.meaning: a musical composition with lyrics
words.example: That song is very catchy.

words.meaning: the area where performers present to an audience
words.example: The actor stood alone on stage.

words.meaning: a famous performer or celebrity
words.example: The movie star attended the premiere.

words.meaning: a place for recording or producing art/films
words.example: They recorded the album in a professional studio.

words.meaning: a place where live plays and performances happen
words.example: We booked tickets for the theatre.

words.meaning: a pass allowing entry to an event
words.example: Get a ticket to see the show.

words.meaning: a melody or short piece of music
words.example: She hummed a familiar tune.

words.meaning: television; a device or broadcast service for video content
words.example: The TV show starts at nine.

words.meaning: a bowed string instrument
words.example: She plays the violin in the orchestra.

words.meaning: a person who writes books, articles or stories
words.example: The writer published a new novel.
